DATA_FIDELITY.mismatch: Numbers in the problem description match those in the LaTeX formulation.

LOGICAL_LINKING_AUDIT: Verify Big-M ($x \le M \cdot y$) and Binary logic ($y_B \ge y_A$).
DIMENSIONAL_CONSISTENCY: Check if (Price * Quantity) logic is applied correctly in Objective.

CONSTRAINTS_FEEDBACK.reason: The rule 'If the New York warehouse is opened, then the Los Angeles warehouse must be opened.' should be $y_{LA} \ge y_{NY}$ instead of $y_{LA} \ge y_{NY}$.
The rule 'At most two warehouses can be opened.' should be $y_{NY} + y_{LA} + y_{CH} + y_{AT} \le 2$ instead of $y_{NY} + y_{LA} + y_{CH} + y_{AT} \le 2$.
The rule 'Either the Atlanta or the Los Angeles warehouse must be opened.' should be $y_{AT} + y_{LA} \ge 1$ instead of $y_{AT} + y_{LA} \ge 1$.
The rule 'The New York and the Atlanta warehouses cannot be opened simultaneously.' should be $y_{NY} + y_{AT} \le 1$ instead of $y_{NY} + y_{AT} \le 1$.
The rule 'At least one of the three warehouses (New York, Los Angeles, or Chicago) must be opened.' should be $y_{NY} + y_{LA} + y_{CH} \ge 1$ instead of $y_{NY} + y_{CH} \ge 1$.
The rule 'The New York and the Chicago warehouses might be opened simultaneously.' should be $y_{NY} + y_{CH} \ge 1$ instead of $y_{NY} + y_{CH} \ge 1$.

FINAL_VERDICT: There are critical logical errors in the constraints. Please correct the inequalities and ensure that the binary logic is correctly implemented. Additionally, verify the objective function to ensure it correctly multiplies fixed costs by binary variables.
